data.title: Blending of PMA with non PMA
data.body:
Hello Daniel,

We were having issues when we used some blend modes, especially additive with non PMA textures from ATF.

Example:
![atfstandard](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24419/9732654/c2fd3692-5625-11e5-8cb7-8c70ed11dfcc.png)
The background on the left side is a PNG (so PMA) and on the right side an ATF (so non PMA) with blend mode none.
The 2 green spots at the top are PNG (so PMA) in additive.
The 2 green spots at the bottom are ATF (so non PMA) in additive.
There are also a white cloud PNG between the two top spots and a white cloud ATF between the two bottom spots in additive.
In the middle there is a render texture with only the alpha channel.

You can see that there is an issue where the alpha is not zero for the ATFs.
It also appear when blendMode is Normal for non PMA on top of PMA.

We found out that the issue happen because the blend mode factors only take into account the source PMA state and expect the destination to be of the same PMA state. As we cannot know the destination PMA state (it can even vary from pixel to pixel), we came up with 2 solutions that would fix the bug.

The first solution is already discussed in another issue, we could alter the quadbatch fragment shader to alter the output color when not PMA to premultiply everything or the other way around, just to make sure everything is the same. Of course this is not without a potential performance impact since we add a MUL or a DIV in the shader for every pixel drawn from certain texture.

The other solution is simply to premultiply the source image supplied to the ATF converter and allow us to say wether the ATF is PMA or not (as right now you force the PMA flag to off when uploading an ATF). That way everything would be PMA and it will works flawlessly.

So my request would be for you to add a pma flag to TextureOptions and an additional argument to fromAtfData(..) plus the additional plumbing between AssetManager and Texture. It is transparent for existing users and it would fix all our issues with PMA / non PMA.

Here is the same example where we did just that : manually premultiplied the png before submitting to png2atf then forced the pma to true in fromAtfData().
![atfwithpma](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24419/9738872/c7a3c152-564d-11e5-9f9b-d05d30d0787a.png)

I can do the patch myself and submit it if you want.
What do you think ?

Seb

data.title: TextField align behavior (autoSize & hAlign)

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.body:
Greetings!

Today I swam in starling code and find one confused thing:
TextField with `autoSize != "none"` ignore `hAlign` and `vAlign` values e.g.

---

In this sample TextField 100x100 **without** autoSizing feature:

``` actionscript3
var textField:TextField = new TextField(100, 100, "Hello\nStarling");
textField.border = true;
textField.hAlign = HAlign.RIGHT;
textField.vAlign = VAlign.BOTTOM;
```

Result:
![none](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1263469/9718448/688a264e-5584-11e5-82bf-d0f10319d40e.png)

---

In this sample TextField 100x100 **with** autoSizing feautre

``` actionscript3
var textField:TextField = new TextField(100, 100, "Hello\nStarling");
textField.border = true;
textField.hAlign = HAlign.RIGHT;
textField.vAlign = VAlign.BOTTOM;

textField.autoSize = TextFieldAutoSize.NONE;            // Enable atuoSize
```

Result:
![bothdirection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1263469/9718453/7eee239a-5584-11e5-9554-7f2e0aee9332.png)

As you can see there is no align to right side

---

In this sample used trick: textField define bounds with _with autoSizing_ and after set textField bounds to this values but _without autoSizing_

``` actionscript3
var textField:TextField = new TextField(100, 100, "Hello\nStarling");
textField.border = true;
textField.hAlign = HAlign.RIGHT;
textField.vAlign = VAlign.BOTTOM;

textField.autoSize = TextFieldAutoSize.BOTH_DIRECTIONS; // Enable autoSize for measuring
var bounds:Rectangle = textField.bounds;                // Save auto measured size
textField.width = bounds.width;                         // Use auto measured width
textField.height = bounds.height;                       // Use auto measured height
textField.autoSize = TextFieldAutoSize.NONE;            // Disable autoSize
```

Result:
![none resized](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1263469/9718455/86bf12c8-5584-11e5-9dac-aae557d89792.png)

---

Native flash text field does not have a similar behavior, and for me this is no expected behavior (not only for me, I find [this unanswered post](http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/setting-horizontal-autosize-forces-left-align) on starling forum)

data.title: Fix issue with Textfield when native filters are applied

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.title: Flattening FragmentFilter cache causes QuadBatch to dispose texture in use?
data.body:
I only confirmed this problem with my ported starling 1.7, but this should happen with original version.
Finally I found out that QuadBatch was dispoing cached texture. FragmentFilter returns cached QuadBatch instance if it already has cache created before flattening, and QuadBatch disposes it even though it's still owned by FragmentFilter.

https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/v1.7/starling/src/starling/filters/FragmentFilter.as#L548

I tried turning off `QuadBatch.ownsTexture` property and the problem seems gone.

https://github.com/vroad/starling-openfl/commit/e440b23948d87b8330c5d598abd28e5b1d065294

data.title: memory leak problem with blurfilter
Fixing ArgumentError: Error #3672
data.body:
I'm using fresh staring and air 18 on android for my game. For some months I have been getting thousands of errors (like below). Tried different ways to fix it but no success until I have found a stable way to reproduce the case. After I suspend the app and open it I catch nativeApplication's Event.ACTIVATE and call starling.start(), I also open some new game popup with newly uploaded textures. Right after this I get the error witch lead to some strange rendering.

```
ArgumentError: Error #3672
    at starling.display::QuadBatch/createBuffers()
```

Now I have added following lines right before calling starling.start() and the bug is gone!

```
Starling.current.context.clear();
Starling.current.context.present();
```

I know my story lacks details and a good example to reproduce, but may be it will help someone (this problem seams petty popular). And probably bugtracking system in not the place for this )

data.title: Pooling Matrix, Vector.<Number> and VertexData
data.body:
Hi Daniel,

I am wondering if it could be a good idea to pool theses 3 objects globally in Starling?
From my understanding, it would require some overrided dispose() in a few classe to put the objects back into their pool when no longer needed.
I'm guessing it could be a really good performance boost because we are creating quite a few of theses frequently.
I could do it and provide a patch I think but I dont want to go down that road if you don't think it's a good idea.

So.. what's your opinion ?

data.title: Feature Request: Touch.isStillTouching()
Button 'onTouch' event null reference
data.body:
Hi there Daniel,

I'm facing a pretty random issue regarding the touch management on the Button.as class. My app in production is logging null reference errors at the 'onTouch' class. I only managed to generate this issue once, "spamming" a button and moving it at the same time. It crashed me at the line 166 of this class. The mTriggerBounds variable was null, which makes me think that somehow, it "skipped" or didn't get into the previous BEGAN/DOWN condition where this variable gets filled. I spent quite a while yesterday trying to get a 100% repro steps, but wasn't lucky at all. I guess a security check could easily solve the issue, but to be honest I'm intrigued on what could be happening here!

Thanks for the support!

data.title: FeatureRequest: Allow mask touchable to be false - Fix Included
data.body:
Line 295 of DisplayObject.as , in hitTest()
         if (mMask && !hitTestMask(localPoint)) return null;
should probably be changed to
         if (mMask && mask.touchable && !hitTestMask(localPoint)) return null;

If masks can't be set to "touchable=false", it prevents "scratch ticket" functionality, such as this (rub mouse over hidden shapes):

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/107200878/MaskCanvasStrokes.html

With the old code, all hit tests always failed, and the demo above doesn't work, as there was no way to detect that the masked out images received touches.

For source code for the demo, update Starling Extension Graphics source tree from GitHub
https://github.com/StarlingGraphics/Starling-Extension-Graphics
and get the demo code here:
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/starling-extension-graphics/page/2?replies=34#post-83278

Request: Better documentation for AssetManager.dispose();
data.body: The function documentation for AssetManager.dispose() does not indicate that the dictionaries are preserved. Users who have missed the purge() function may assume that dispose() will also clear the dictionaries.

data.title: Add subScale parameter in SubTexture
AssetManager.as : making the call to System.gc() in finish() optional/disabled by default
data.body: Hi ! Following the topic started by as3gpu and his findings here : The issue is currently Assetmanager forces garbage collection (on Air apps or flash player debugger) with System.gc() here : https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/utils/AssetManager.as#L743 This should not be a problem where you load assets during a static loading screen as this is a good time to collect garbage anyway, however in a scenario where one uses multiple asset managers, some to load in assets during the app/game, this will force garbage collection during the game/app and potentially cause an undesirable fps drop. the suggestion is to make this System.gc() call or even System.pauseForGCIfCollectionImminent(0); optional and in my opinion even disabled by default in the Assetmanager class directly provided with Starling - to avoid having to extend it just for that.

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from Gamua/master
data.body: update my fork

data.title: Separating Glow and Blur filters
adding feature "frameEvents" to starling movieClip
data.body: I have added the ability to have an event that is dispatched on a specific frame of a starling.display.MovieClip.  Ideally this would replace frameSound because it is more ubiquitous.  In this version frameSound has been left intact and the functions getFrameEvent & setFrameEvent have been added as well as mEvents vector and dispatchFrameEvent function. The dispatchFrameEvent function is called after the playSound function is called. A new const was also added starling.events.Event.MOVIE_CLIP_FRAME_EVENT

data.title: Two cases of isStateChange call that might not be properly checking numQuads hits max
data.body:
Looks like there might be two cases where a call to isStateChange is not properly checking the actual numQuads max reach limit when checking for a state change when adding a QuadBatch.

In RenderSupport, line 577, the call:
            if (mQuadBatches[mCurrentQuadBatchID].isStateChange(
                quadBatch.tinted, parentAlpha, quadBatch.texture, quadBatch.smoothing, mBlendMode))
needs to be:
            if (mQuadBatches[mCurrentQuadBatchID].isStateChange(
                quadBatch.tinted, parentAlpha, quadBatch.texture, quadBatch.smoothing, mBlendMode, quadBatch.numQuads))

also, in QuadBatch, line 519, the call:
                    if (!batch1.isStateChange(batch2.tinted, 1.0, batch2.texture,
                                              batch2.smoothing, batch2.blendMode))
needs to be:
                    if (!batch1.isStateChange(batch2.tinted, 1.0, batch2.texture,
                                              batch2.smoothing, batch2.blendMode, batch2.numQuads))
what I think could happen now is without this extra numQuads capacity check (incorrectly checking as a numQuads = 1 default), an addQuadBatch could happen, and the numQuads will be clipped at MAX_NUM_QUADS, not generating an error, but the extra quads in the secondary QuadBatch I think would not get copied in and lost in the render?

data.title: Incoherence in ScrollContainer using displayListBypassEnabled=true
data.body: `displayListBypassEnabled` overrides `addChildAt`, but doesn't do the same with `addChild`. The problem is that `addChild` uses `mChildren.length` as index and `addChildAt` uses the `this.viewPort` as container, raising `RangeError: Invalid child index`.

data.body: Just a quick fix, I guess it's harmless.
